Class L3Handler

  • java.lang.Object
    • L3Handler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    L3ShimListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    L3Iface, L3RoutedIface

    public abstract class L3Handler
extends java.lang.Object
implements L3ShimListener
    This abstract class represents a L3 object that can send and receive L3 frames. For packets to be sent, the class compares the destination L3addr to the routes in the routing table to determine a next-hop L3addr. This next-hop L3addr is passed down to the next layer with the pkt. The class is subclassed to implement the dropReceivedPacket() function to distinguish between a router interface that routes packets with a destination address that isn't one of its addresses, and a host interface that accepts only packets destined for it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • L3Handler

        public L3Handler(Layer2Endpoint l2e,
                 int netPart)
        Create a L3Handler, given a layer 2 endpoint, and the network part of the L3Address. The host part comes from the L2 address in the layer 2 endpoint. The code creates an L3Shim object (and storing it), sets itself as a listener for that object, and creates and stores the L3Address for this object, from the given netPart and layer 2's unique Mac address.

    • Method Detail

        public void send(L3Packet pkt,
                 L3Address nextHop)

      • dropReceivedPacket

        public boolean dropReceivedPacket(L3Packet pkt,
                                  java.lang.String bits)
        throw a RuntimeException. This is a template method: it must be implemented by the subclasses. If you don't understand this, ask Andrew G., Lydia C., David M., Austin S., or Spencer S.

      • packetReceived

        public void packetReceived(Layer2Endpoint l2e,
                           java.lang.String bits)
        Called when the layer below receives bits successfully. Like the layer 2 implementation, it calls dropReceivedPacket to determine if the received packet should be dropped, instead of passed on through the listener packetReceived() callback to the higher layer.
        Specified by:
        packetReceived in interface L3ShimListener
